title: Three teens arrested inside a Florida Publix after filming themselves with pistols in the store
text:
Three teenage boys were arrested at gunpoint inside a Publix supermarket in Florida on Tuesday after they filmed themselves posing with guns in the store's bathroom and posted it to Snapchat.

Investigators say the video showed the three boys clutching two handguns and then racking the slides inside a Wesley Chapel branch of the store - prompting an emergency response from the Pasco County Sheriff's Office who were forwarded the clip.

The boys, who were aged between 15 and 16, were detained at gunpoint in the dairy section of the supermarket.

One boy, 16, had a loaded Sig Sauer P228 handgun hidden in his shorts, a police report released Wednesday alleges. Another 16-year-old had a Sig Sauer P238 handgun tucked into his waistband.

Investigators say the video showed the three boys clutching two handguns and then racking the slides inside a Wesley Chapel branch of the store (above), prompting an emergency response from the Pasco County Sherriff's Office who were forwarded the clip

The first teen reportedly try to tell officers he got the gun from a 'friend', admitting he thought about throwing the gun away and running from law enforcement as they approached.

He has prior convictions for battery on a law enforcement officer, grand theft, and grand theft motor vehicle, and was arrested Tuesday for carrying a concealed firearm and delinquent in possession of a fire arm.

The second of the two 16-year-olds is accused of stealing his handgun after breaking into an unlocked vehicle in Saddlebrook and taking it from the glove box.

The boy was also found in possession of two stolen credit cards, a passport, driver's licence and other items linking back to the auto robbery, police said.

He was arrested on two counts of auto burglary, theft of a firearm, theft of a credit card, delinquent in possession of a firearm, and carrying a concealed firearm.

The third boy, aged 15, who initially refused to give officers his name, had a black backpack with a single round of ammunition inside it.

He had a prior conviction for an aggravated assault charge with a firearm and was charged with delinquent in possession of ammunition as well as resisting an officer and obstructing without violence.

One boy, 16, had a loaded Sig Sauer P228 handgun (shown in file photo above) hidden in his shorts, a police report released Wednesday alleges. Another 16-year-old had a Sig Sauer P238 handgun tucked into his waistband

All three of the teens live about an hour away from the store, in Pinellas County. They were taken to the county jail in Land O'Lakes.

Their stunt came just over a month after Publix banned customers from openly carrying firearms in their stores, joining the likes of Walmart and Target in doing so.

The move came in response to a spate of mass shootings, including the El Paso Walmart shooting and the Dayton Ohio shooting which killed 31 and injured dozens more.

'Publix respectfully requests that only law enforcement officials openly carry firearms in our stores,' the Florida-based grocery chain said in a statement in September.
description: Investigators say the boys filmed themselves clutching two handguns and then racking the slides inside a Wesley Chapel branch of the store. They were arrested in the dairy section of the store.
